qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.nlopts.crs module¶

class qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.nlopts.crs.CRS[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.optimizer.Optimizer

Controlled Random Search (CRS) with local mutation.

NLopt global optimizer, derivative-free https://nlopt.readthedocs.io/en/latest/NLopt_Algorithms/#controlled-random-search-crs-with-local-mutation

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'GN_CRS2_LM Optimizer', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'crs_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'max_evals': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1000}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'CRS', 'optimizer': ['global'], 'options': ['max_evals'], 'support_level': {'gradient': <SupportLevel.ignored: 1>, 'bounds': <SupportLevel.supported: 2>, 'initial_point': <SupportLevel.required: 3>}}¶
DEFAULT_CONFIGURATION = {'options': [], 'support_level': {'gradient': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>, 'bounds': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>, 'initial_point': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>}}¶
class SupportLevel¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enumeration.

ignored = 1¶
not_supported = 0¶
required = 3¶
supported = 2¶
bounds_support_level¶
static check_pluggable_valid()[source]¶

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not

configuration¶

Return pluggable configuration.

static gradient_num_diff(x_center, f, epsilon)¶

We compute the gradient with the numeric differentiation in the parallel way, around the point x_center. :param x_center: point around which we compute the gradient :type x_center: ndarray :param f: the function of which the gradient is to be computed. :type f: func :param epsilon: the epsilon used in the numeric differentiation. :type epsilon: float

Returns:the gradient computed
Return type:grad
gradient_support_level¶
classmethod init_params(params)¶

Initialize with a params dictionary

A dictionary of config params as per the configuration object. Some of these params get passed to scipy optimizers in an options dictionary. We can specify an options array of names in config dictionary to have the options dictionary automatically populated. All other config items, excluding name, will be passed to init_args

Parameters:params (dict) – configuration dict
initial_point_support_level¶
is_bounds_ignored¶
is_bounds_required¶
is_bounds_supported¶
is_gradient_ignored¶
is_gradient_required¶
is_gradient_supported¶
is_initial_point_ignored¶
is_initial_point_required¶
is_initial_point_supported¶
optimize(num_vars, objective_function, gradient_function=None, variable_bounds=None, initial_point=None)[source]¶

Perform optimization.

Parameters:
  • num_vars (int) – number of parameters to be optimized.
  • objective_function (callable) – handle to a function that computes the objective function.
  • gradient_function (callable) – handle to a function that computes the gradient of the objective function, or None if not available.
  • variable_bounds (list[(float, float)]) – list of variable bounds, given as pairs (lower, upper). None means unbounded.
  • initial_point (numpy.ndarray[float]) – initial point.
Returns:

point, value, nfev

point: is a 1D numpy.ndarray[float] containing the solution value: is a float with the objective function value nfev: number of objective function calls made if available or None
print_options()¶

Print algorithm-specific options.

set_batch_mode(mode)¶
set_options(**kwargs)¶

Set an options dictionary that may be used by call to the optimizer

Parameters:kwargs (dict) – options, given as name=value.
setting¶
validate(args_dict)¶
static wrap_function(function, args)¶

Wrap the function to implicitly inject the args at the call of the function. :param function: the target function :type function: func :param args: the args to be injected :type args: tuple

qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.nlopts.direct_l module¶

class qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.nlopts.direct_l.DIRECT_L[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.optimizer.Optimizer

DIRECT is the DIviding RECTangles algorithm for global optimization.

DIRECT-L is the “locally biased” variant NLopt global optimizer, derivative-free http://nlopt.readthedocs.io/en/latest/NLopt_Algorithms/#direct-and-direct-l

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'GN_DIRECT_L Optimizer', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'direct_l_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'max_evals': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1000}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'DIRECT_L', 'optimizer': ['global'], 'options': ['max_evals'], 'support_level': {'gradient': <SupportLevel.ignored: 1>, 'bounds': <SupportLevel.supported: 2>, 'initial_point': <SupportLevel.required: 3>}}¶
DEFAULT_CONFIGURATION = {'options': [], 'support_level': {'gradient': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>, 'bounds': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>, 'initial_point': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>}}¶

static gradient_num_diff(x_center, f, epsilon)¶

We compute the gradient with the numeric differentiation in the parallel way, around the point x_center. :param x_center: point around which we compute the gradient :type x_center: ndarray :param f: the function of which the gradient is to be computed. :type f: func :param epsilon: the epsilon used in the numeric differentiation. :type epsilon: float

Returns:the gradient computed

classmethod init_params(params)¶

Initialize with a params dictionary

A dictionary of config params as per the configuration object. Some of these params get passed to scipy optimizers in an options dictionary. We can specify an options array of names in config dictionary to have the options dictionary automatically populated. All other config items, excluding name, will be passed to init_args

optimize(num_vars, objective_function, gradient_function=None, variable_bounds=None, initial_point=None)[source]¶

Perform optimization.

Parameters:
  • num_vars (int) – number of parameters to be optimized.
  • objective_function (callable) – handle to a function that computes the objective function.
  • gradient_function (callable) – handle to a function that computes the gradient of the objective function, or None if not available.
  • variable_bounds (list[(float, float)]) – list of variable bounds, given as pairs (lower, upper). None means unbounded.
  • initial_point (numpy.ndarray[float]) – initial point.
Returns:

point, value, nfev

point: is a 1D numpy.ndarray[float] containing the solution value: is a float with the objective function value nfev: number of objective function calls made if available or None

qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.nlopts.direct_l_rand module¶

class qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.nlopts.direct_l_rand.DIRECT_L_RAND[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.optimizer.Optimizer

DIRECT is the DIviding RECTangles algorithm for global optimization.

DIRECT-L RAND is the “locally biased” variant with some randomization in near-tie decisions NLopt global optimizer, derivative-free http://nlopt.readthedocs.io/en/latest/NLopt_Algorithms/#direct-and-direct-l

CONFIGURATION = {'description': 'GN_DIRECT_L_RAND Optimizer', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'direct_l_rand_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'max_evals': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1000}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'DIRECT_L_RAND', 'optimizer': ['global'], 'options': ['max_evals'], 'support_level': {'gradient': <SupportLevel.ignored: 1>, 'bounds': <SupportLevel.supported: 2>, 'initial_point': <SupportLevel.required: 3>}}¶
DEFAULT_CONFIGURATION = {'options': [], 'support_level': {'gradient': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>, 'bounds': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>, 'initial_point': <SupportLevel.not_supported: 0>}}¶

Perform optimization.

Parameters:
  • num_vars (int) – number of parameters to be optimized.
  • objective_function (callable) – handle to a function that computes the objective function.
  • gradient_function (callable) – handle to a function that computes the gradient of the objective function, or None if not available.
  • variable_bounds (list[(float, float)]) – list of variable bounds, given as pairs (lower, upper). None means unbounded.
  • initial_point (numpy.ndarray[float]) – initial point.

point, value, nfev

Bases: qiskit_aqua.components.optimizers.optimizer.Optimizer

ESCH (evolutionary algorithm).

NLopt global optimizer, derivative-free http://nlopt.readthedocs.io/en/latest/NLopt_Algorithms/#esch-evolutionary-algorithm
